author: Morgan Housel
summary: Getting money requires taking risks and being optimistic. Keeping money requires the opposite - humility, frugality, and fear that what you've made can be taken away. Jesse Livermore made billions in 1929 but lost everything by 1933.
key_takeaways: Getting money and keeping money are two different skills.
Survival is the cornerstone of any financial strategy.
Plan on the plan not going according to plan.

questions.question: If you could summarize money success in a single word, what would it be?
questions.explanation: The ability to stick around for a long time, without wiping out or being forced to give up, is what makes the biggest difference. This should be the cornerstone of your strategy.

questions.question: Why does keeping money require the OPPOSITE mindset of getting money?

options.text: Because wealthy people face different tax laws
Getting money requires risk and optimism; keeping it requires humility, frugality, and fear
Because banks treat rich and poor customers differently
Because wealthy people have access to safer investments

questions.explanation: Getting money requires taking risks, being optimistic, and putting yourself out there. Keeping money requires humility, fear that what you've made can be taken away, and accepting that luck played a role.

questions.question: What is the most important part of every financial plan?

options.text: Planning on the plan not going according to plan
Following the exact strategy of successful investors
Maximizing returns in the first 5 years

questions.explanation: A plan is only useful if it can survive reality. The more you need specific elements of a plan to be true, the more fragile your financial life becomes. Room for error is one of the most underappreciated forces in finance.
